Key Match Events: Tim David and Mitchell Marsh helped Australia secure a dramatic last-ball win against New Zealand, chasing down 16 in the final over in Wellington.
Pre-Game Insights: Glenn Maxwell will surpass Aaron Finch (103) for the most appearances for Australia in men’s T20Is.
David Warner needs 54 runs to become the all-time leading run scorer for Australia in men’s T20Is (Aaron Finch – 3,120).
Steve Smith might not make the Playing XI according to Mitchell Marsh.
Australia enter the series after a 2-1 T20I series win at home against the West Indies. Meanwhile, New Zealand routed Pakistan in their previous T20I series by a 4-1 margin.
Mitchell Marsh will be leading Australia despite the return of Pat Cummins while Mitchell Santner will captain New Zealand.
Regular captain Kane Williamson will miss the series expecting the birth of his third child. New Zealand will also miss the services of all-rounder Daryl Mitchell owing to an injury.
Post-Match Reflections: What a chase this has been!
Australia tour of New Zealand, 2024 - 1st T20I: Australia beat New Zealand by 6 wickets.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Weather or field conditions affecting the match
This was the 100th meeting between the two teams
The 2021 T20 world champion Australia will have an arsenal of destructive forces at their disposal with the likes of Glenn Maxwell and Tim David being available.
